conclusion: Basketball is dropped from height H and experiences air resistance.
Force due to air resistance is lambda mg, where lambda is a constant.
Net acceleration a_1 downward is a_1 = g(1 + lambda).
Post-collision, basketball rebounds to height h.
Net acceleration a_2 upward is a_2 = g(1 - lambda).
Ratio of post-collision velocity v_t to pre-collision velocity v_0 is sqrt((1 - lambda)h / (1 + lambda)H).
Conclusion: The ratio of the post-collision velocity to the pre-collision velocity is sqrt((1 - lambda)h / (1 + lambda)H).
Analysis based on given conditions and image, which does not directly pertain to calculations but may provide context of motion analysis.
